Name: Hercules Fighting a Lion
Description: The pottery piece is from the bottom of a patera, an ancient Roman shallow bowl without handles. The Alexandrian shard shows a scene of the Greek hero Hercules fighting the Nemean lion, the first of his 12 extraordinary deeds. Hercules is depicted nude and fighting the Nemean lion by hand. The lion places his left back foot on the knee of Hercules, and his front one on his chest. Hercules' arrows and club could not harm the lion, but the club is still visible in the background. Hercules won by strangling the lion, according to the myth.
